articles.author: Lee Davey
articles.title: Africa Cup of Nations: Gambia down Guinea to reach quarter-finals as fairytale debut continues - Eurosport.com
articles.description: Musa Barrow's goal 19 minutes from time gave Gambia a 1-0 win over Guinea to send the scorpions to their first-ever Africa Cup of Nations quarter final.
articles.content:
Gambia's midfielder Musa Barrow (C) celebrates scoring
Image credit: Getty Images

articles.title: Burkina Faso President Roch Kabore detained at military camp by soldiers following mutiny - News24
articles.description: Burkina Faso President Roch Kabore has been detained at a military camp by mutinying soldiers, according to four security sources and a West African diplomat, following heavy gunfire around his residence on Sunday night in the capital Ouagadougou.
articles.content:
• President Roch Kabore has been detained at a military camp by mutinying soldiers in Burkina Faso.

articles.title: R11.4 billion World Bank loan could be used to help fund new grants for South Africa: economists - BusinessTech
articles.description: On Friday (21 January), the World Bank approved an R11.3 billion ($750 million) development policy loan for South Africa, with questions now being raised about how the additional money could be used.

articles.author: Eyewitness News
articles.title: Ramaphosa: ANC must act against the stoking of anti-African sentiment - Eyewitness News
articles.description: In the midst of growing tension between South Africans and migrant workers, the African National Congress (ACN)’s national executive committee lekgotla has resolved to lead the debate on immigration.
articles.content: In the midst of growing tension between South Africans and migrant workers, the African National Congress (ACN)’s national executive committee lekgotla has resolved to lead the debate on immigration.… [+989 chars]

articles.author: Nicole McCain
articles.title: Covid-19: SA records 1 931 new infections and 17 new deaths - News24
articles.description: South Africa recorded 1 931 new Covid-19 infections on Sunday, representing an 8.6% positivity rate.
articles.content:
• South Africa recorded 1 931 new cases of Covid-19 on Sunday.
  • Seventeen deaths were also recorded, bringing the death toll to 94 177.
  • Gauteng recorded 26% of the new cases.
